title: The Parking Spot Standoff
setting: Garrison & Associates Law Firm, parking garage, Wednesday 7:45 AM
premise: Someone poured a bucket of paint in Reserved Spot #1, the managing partner's spot, ruining it overnight. The garage has no cameras but does have a keycard gate.

suspects.name: Leah Fontaine
suspects.motive: Was denied a reserved parking spot despite being at the firm for eight years
suspects.alibi: I left the office at 7 PM Tuesday and drove straight home. I watched a documentary until 10 PM and went to bed. My home security camera shows my car parked all night.

suspects.name: Carl Jennings
suspects.motive: The managing partner rejected his expense report and embarrassed him in front of coworkers
suspects.alibi: I was at my bowling league Tuesday night from 7 to 10 PM. After that I went to the bar with my teammates. I got home around midnight.

suspects.name: Rosa Delgado
suspects.motive: Her car was scratched in the garage last month and she suspects the managing partner did it
suspects.alibi: I take the bus, I don't even have a garage keycard. I left at 5 PM Tuesday and went home to cook dinner for my family.

suspects.name: Neil Ashworth
suspects.motive: The managing partner stole credit for his brief that won a major case
suspects.alibi: I stayed late working on a motion until around 9 PM Tuesday. Then I drove home. I came back Wednesday morning at 7:30 and noticed the mess.

clues.title: Paint Can Evidence
clues.content: The empty paint can was found in the garage stairwell trash bin. It's a common hardware store brand â€” no fingerprints were recovered due to the paint residue.

clues.title: Keycard Gate Log
clues.content: The parking garage keycard log shows three after-hours entries Tuesday night: Neil at 5:02 PM (entry), Neil at 9:08 PM (exit), and one more entry at 11:47 PM using Carl's keycard.

clues.title: Bowling Alley Timestamp
clues.content: The bowling alley's electronic scoring system shows Carl's last game ended at 9:34 PM. The bar he claims to have gone to is a forty-minute drive from the office garage.

hints.text: Check who could have physically entered the parking garage late Tuesday night.
Does the timeline between the bowling alley and the claimed bar visit leave room for a detour?
